abstract: Kenneth R Feinberg, administrator of General Motors' compensation program for ignition-switch defects in its cars, says automaker has received 75 new claims, bringing total to 4,312.
lead_paragraph: General Motors received 75 claims last week for compensation for ignition-switch defects in its cars, bringing the total to 4,312, the official administering the compensation program said on Monday.

headline.main: G.M. Updates Totals on Switch-Defect Claims
headline.print_headline: G.M. Updates Totals on Switch-Defect Claims

snippet: General Motors received 75 claims last week for compensation for ignition-switch defects in its cars, bringing the total to 4,312, the official administering the compensation program said on Monday.
